Event Poller Resources Configuration. If the "event.poller.urls" configuration is defined, this field's value is ignored. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - {     "contacts": {         "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts",         "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at",         "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX",         "pageSize": 10000     } }
configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration

description: Add a Zoho CRM V2 Instance to connect your existing Zoho CRM account to the CRM Hub, allowing you to manage contacts, leads, accounts, opportunities etc. across multiple CRM Elements. You will need your Zoho CRM account information to add an instance.

Create a new account note in the CRM system. account note creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'account note' model are those required to create a new account note

resources.description: Find activities_events in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all activities_events whose Subject is the word 'discussion', the search expression parameter will be where=Subject='discussion'. To search for an activities_event where the Subject starts with the word 'discussion' the search query whould be where=Subject like '%discussion' If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned \n

Description.x-samplevalue: max payload with daily freq and contact related

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all activities-events whose payload contains the word 'discussion', the search expression parameter will be where=word='discussion'. To search for activities-events where Event_Title starts with 'max', the query will be where=Event_Title='max%'. The supported join is 'and'and the operator supported is '='

resources.description:
Create a new activities-event in the CRM system. activities-event creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'activities-event' model are those required to create a new activities-event
\n

resources.description: Retrieve status of bulk job on vendor

Find campaigns in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all campaigns which contain the word test, the search expression parameter will be where=word='test', If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all campaigns whose payload contains the word 'discussion', the search expression parameter will be where=word='discussion'. To search for campaigns where Campaign_Name starts with 'max', the query will be where=Campaign_Name='max%'. The supported join is 'and'and the operator supported is '='

For example, to search for all notes whose payload contains the word 'discussion', the search expression parameter will be where=word='discussion'. To search for notes where Note_Title starts with 'max', the query will be where=Note_Title='max%'. The supported join is 'and'and the operator supported is '='
